page.title: 09CHURCH ARCHITECTURE
page.content: The attractive village of Chewton Mendip has a beautiful church with a famous Somerset tower in the perpendicular style. Dedicated to Mary Magdelene the church has traces of a Saxon building on the site of the present chancel, and a Norman arch opposite the south door. The peal of eight bells is reputedly the finest in Britain. St Mary's in Litton is a smaller church and tower with a Norman piscina, and a Hagioscope near the pulpit, which is in the Jacobean style like the altar rails. St Lawrence's at East Harptree is largely Norman and is set in the midst of a pretty stone built village. All three churches are well worth a visit.
